result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mark L. Moore
Current: P.O. Box 711, Tomahawk, WI 54487-0711 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2016)
Prior: 310 W. Wisconsin Ave. #0, Tomahawk, WI 54487

Defendant Mark L. Moore in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Parties have review the revocation packets.  No errors were found.
Victim rights have been complied with.

Court orders:
90 days jail - TIME SERVED
Any unpaid Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court are to become civil judgments
92 days sentence credit
from Oneida County Sheriff's Dept for a SEHR on 2/5/16 at 10:45 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-05-2016 10:45 am
of jury is guilty.  Jury is polled by the court.

Miotion in LImine filed by the defense - Points 1-10 heard by the courts.
1.Denies - State can use the word defendent
2. No . of convictions - if asked - yes - one
3. Granted
4.Sequesters request is granted
5.Granted - only call witnesses on list unless on rebuttal
6. Granted - no motions filed
7. No audio received -request sent by defense on 7/31/15 of Ofc. Klein Court does deny the request of the defense for transcripts of the audio
8/9. Denied
10. Sames as States Motion.
State's Motion of admission of statements - Sgt Steven Buckwalter  duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft.  Ofc Anthony Klein  duly sworn and testifies.   State addresses the court that Adam J Benner will not be called to testify.    Arguements heard. Court rules on the admission of statements - granted.  State is checking on the video.  If one the defense would like to listen to it. Get the jury selection stated.  8:58 am

Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski w/Alec Nocco.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case Called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Jury selection @ 9:15 am and completed @ 10:05 am.  Back on the record at 10:20 am. Court to put the sidebars on the record.  9:55 am sidebar - laptop of Attorney Nocco arrived - yes, 10:02am Sidebar jurors not to be worn due to a CD (audio only) coming from Tomahawk.  Jurors brought to the courtroom @ 10:40 am Court explains that they are waiting for a audio to arrive from Tomahawk and it will take some time for the parties to review.  Should be back on the record by 11:30 am.  Jurors excused to the jury room at 10:47am
Back on the record at 11:09 am after parties finished reviewing the audio.  Jurors will be allowed to take notes and write questions for the court to address.  Defense is ready to proceed State is ready to proceed.  Clerk to give 2nd Oath to the Jurors.   Second oath is given to the jurors at 11:15 am.     Court addresses the jurors.   Opening statements given at 11:24 am  
Danyelle Moore  duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft.  Sidebar criminal offenses of the victim.  At 11:50 am Court to break for lunch.  Jurors excused.  Court places the sidebar on the record.  State informs the court that he does have the audio.  Back on the record at 1:00 pm  

Court resumes at 1:00 pm  Sgt Steven Buckwalter duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft  Ofc Anthony Kline  duly sworn and testifies.  Question from a juror asked of the Officer.  State rests.  Court takes a break at 1:46 pm.  Defense will not be calling any witnesses.  Court addresses the deft as to his right to testify.  FVI.  Jurors back 1:50 pm.  All evidence is in.  Court explains procedure to the jurors.  Jurors are excused at 1:52 pm  

Jury conference off the record back in court at 2:13 pm.  Jurors back in court at 2:15 pm.  Jury instructions read by the court.  Closing arguements Jurors excues to deliberate at 2:59 pm.

Jurors have a verdict at 3:34 pm.  Verdict given to the  bailiff  Court reads the verdict.  Jury is excused 3:37 pm

Court would proceed to sentencing.  Victim does not want to be heard.  Arguements heard.

Court orders:
1 year probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Complete your senior year of High School.
Upon successful completion of probation and payment of all fines and court costs, defendant to petition the Court for expungment.
for Hearing on admission of Prior Juvenile convictions afor impeachment purposes relative to the defendant

Defendant Mark L. Moore in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
